Class MoveWithScore

java.lang.Object
  Move
      MoveWithScore

public class MoveWithScore
extends Move

For returning scored moves from Board.bestMove(Scorer s, Player p) since I'm hesitant to complicate Move with an additional score field. Perhaps this shouldn't extend Move?

Version:
2012 May
Author:
Mike Roam

calculates a score using a different scorer. Should this memorize the new score and alternate Scorer? Probably not.

setScore

public void setScore()
with no params means use own scorer to score self on own board.

setScore

public void setScore(double newScore,
                     Scorer newMyScorer)
we're told a score and which Scorer was used to calculate the score, supposedly.

setScore

public void setScore(Scorer newMyScorer)
Gives us a Scorer and asks it to calculate a score. Handy. tells us which Scorer was used to calculate the score, supposedly.

Parameters:
newMyScorer -

setScore

public void setScore(Scorer newMyScorer,
                     Board aBoard)
Gives us a Board & a Scorer and asks it to calculate a score. Handy. tells us which Scorer was used to calculate the score, supposedly.
